intro: Fregirardia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fregirardia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or semi-arid environments. Its botanical classification places it within the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species in botanical studies.
